titlestmt.titleproper: A Collection of Material from the Trianon Press
Finding Aid for a Collection of Material from the Trianon Press, ca. 1952-1983 LSC.1685
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Yasmin Damshenas in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT), with assistance from Megan Hahn Fraser, August 2011; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-18 10:42:52 -0700.

did.unittitle: A Collection of Material from the Trianon Press
did.abstract: The collection consists of reproductions of engravings, etchings, and other artwork published by Trianon Press, a publishing house started by Arnold Fawcus who was well known for producing high quality facsimiles.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], A Collection of Material from the Trianon Press (Collection 1685). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Note
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.
Processed by Yasmin Damshenas in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT), with assistance from Megan Hahn Fraser, August 2011.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Trianon Press was founded in Paris in 1947 by Arnold Fawcus who became well known for producing high quality facsimile art prints. Under the label Trianon Press, he published a number of facsimiles including the work of William Blake. After Fawcus's death, his wife Julie Fawcus continued and completed Trianon's final two projects on Dante Alighieri and John Constable.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of reproductions of engravings, etchings, and other artwork. Among the artists represented are: William Blake, Pieter Brueghel the Elder, Charles-Germain de Saint-Aubin, Camille Pissaro, Fra Bartolommeo, Jean Bérain and Wenceslaus Hollar.

unittitle.title: Jerusalem, the Emanation of the Giant Albion,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Four prints from William Blake's epic poem.

did.unittitle: The World of Seven Virtues (ca. 1560) and The Gates of Paradise

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two images from The World of Seven Virtues by Pieter Brueghel the Elder (representing Justice and Hope). Also, 5 images from The Gates of Paradise by William Blake.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Four landscape images and two pastoral scenes including one with caption "The Holy Mother to be draped in dark…"

did.unittitle: Seven Deadly Sins and The Gates of Paradise

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selection of two images from the Seven Deadly Sins by Pieter Brueghel the Elder. Also, five images from The Gates of Paradise by William Blake.

did.unittitle: Essay de Papilloneries Humaines and Gates of Paradise

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two prints from Essay de Papilloneries Humaines by Charles-Germain de Saint-Aubin and five selected prints from Gates of Paradise by William Blake.

did.unittitle: Essay de Papilloneries Humaines and Adoration of the Magi

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two images from Essay de Papilloneries Humaines by Charles-Germain de Saint-Aubin and two images of the Adoration of the Magi capital at Autun Cathedral sculpted by Gislebertus.

did.unittitle: Essay de Papilloneries Humaines and untitled sketches

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two images from Essay de Papilloneries Humaines by Charles-Germain de Saint-Aubin and two images of sketches of women by John Constable.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selection of landscape images by Pieter Brueghel including Temptation of Christ printed by Hiernonymous Cock.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selection of four images by William Blake.

unittitle.title: Raccolta di paesi e vedute dal vero originale di mano di Andrea del Sarto,

did.unitdate: ca. late 15th century to early 16th century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selection of landscape drawings by Fra Bartolommeo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selection of landscape drawings by Camille Pissaro.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selected images from a landscape series by Pieter Brueghel the Elder, includes Penitent Magdalene, Flight into Egypt.

did.unittitle: Recueil des modes de la cour de France and Adoration of the Magi

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selection of images from Recueil des modes de la cour de France by Jean Berain, ca. late 17th century. Also, includes one close-up image of the Adoration of the Magi capital by Gislebertus at Autun Cathedral.

did.unittitle: Recueil des modes de la cour de France,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 9 selected images of French fashions including Habit d'Hyuer, Habit d'Esté and Habit de Printemps by Jean Berain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selection of sketches by Richard Doyle, illustrator. Note: printed front and back.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selection of pages reproduced from An Island in the Moon by William Blake. Note: Printed front and back.

unittitle.title: The Art of Graving and Etching

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selection of pages and illustrations reproduced from The Art of Graving and Etching by William Faithorne. Note: one print has images on both front and back.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Each with a selection of 5 images of assorted costumes from Mascarades by Robert Bouillard.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Each with a selection of 2 images from the series The Twelve Months by Jan van de Velde.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: By Wenceslaus Hollar. A selection of 12 images of insects.

did.unittitle: Mantegna Tarocchi, artist and date unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 48 images in total, 8 per page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selected images of landscapes and seascapes include seascapes by Joseph Mallord William Turner, ca. 19th century.

did.unittitle: Turner seascapes and Autun Cathedral capitals

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selection of seascapes by Joseph Mallord William Turner. Also Flight into Egypt and Adoration of the Magi, capitals carved by Gislebertus at Autun Cathedral.

did.unittitle: Balli di Sfessania and Varie Figure Gobbi

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selection of images from Balli di Sfessania by Jacques Callot and Varie Figure Gobbi by Jacques Callot.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Selection of images from Balli di Sfessania by Jacques Callot.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Trio of portraits of French court members by School of Clouet. Marquis de Guise and Gaspard II de Coligny by François Clouet, Marguerite de Valois, Queen of Navarre by Jean Clouet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Trio of portraits of French court members by School of Clouet. Count of Brissac by François Clouet, Antoine de Bourbon King of Navarre by Studio of Clouet, Dona Beatrix Pacheo by Jean Clouet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Trio of portraits of French court members by the School of Clouet. Includes Anne de Montmorency by François Clouet and Gaspard II de Coligny by François Clouet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2 prints of a trio of portraits of French court members by School of Clouet. Marguerite de Valois, Queen of Navarre by François Clouet, Louis de Bourbon by Jean Clouet, Jacques de Brouillard by François Clouet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Trio of portraits of French court members by School of Clouet. Jeanne III d'Albret, reine de Navarre, princesse de Béarn, comtesse de Foix by François Clouet, unidentified female, Claude de Lorraine Ier, duc de Guise, comte d'Aumale, marquis de Mayenne et d'Elbeuf by François Clouet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Trio of portraits of French court members by School of Clouet. Includes Henri II, King of France by François Clouet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A sampling of 6 ornamental engravings by Jean Louis Bérain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 8 ornamental engravings by Daniel Mignot.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A set of 8 landscape prints by Willem Buytewech.

did.unittitle: Untitled landscapes and Dance of Death

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two landscapes by Willem Buytewech and 6 images from Dance of Death by Wenceslaus Hollar (engraver) and Abraham van Diepenbeeck (printer).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Each print has 8 images by Wenceslaus Hollar (engraver) and Abraham van Diepenbeeck (printer).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Each with 18 prints by Wenceslaus Hollar. From Hollar's series on women's style of dress from different countries.

did.unittitle: Sailing Vessels and The Gates of Paradise

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Each print has two images from Sailing Vessels series by Pieter Brueghel, the Elder (artist), Frans Huys (engraver). Also five selected images from The Gates of Paradise by William Blake, ca. 1793.
